knimeNode.name: String to Date&Time
knimeNode.shortDescription: Parses date and/or time strings into Date&Time cells.

intro.p: Parses the strings in the selected columns and converts them into Date&Time cells. The expected format can be selected from a number of commonly used formats or specified manually (see section "Type and Format Selection").
Since dates may contain localized terms such as month or weekday names, you can additionally specify a locale.

tab.name: Column Selection
tab.option: Only the included columns will be parsed.

tab.name: Replace/Append Selection
tab.option: The selected columns will be appended to the input table. The suffix of the appended columns can be provided in the text field to the right.
The selected columns will be replaced by the converted columns.

tab.name: Type and Format Selection
tab.option: The type of the new data cells can be selected.

option.name: Date format
option.p: A template ("format string") that specifies how to interpret the input. This template may contain placeholders for different descriptions of month names, weekday names, month and day numbers, year numbers etc., as well as other non-alphabetic characters that are expected to appear in the input string.
Commonly used placeholders are y for year, M for month, d for day of month, H for hours, m for minutes and s for seconds. A full list of placeholders can be found below.

The count of an individual placeholder letter defines the expected format. For example, a weekday can be represented by its full name ("Monday"), a short name ("Mon") or a narrow name ("M"). Commonly used expressions are:

ul.li: yyyy matches "2021". yy matches years relative to the year 2000: "21" will be interpreted as "2021".
MM matches month numbers like "01", MMM matches short month names like "Jan", MMMM matches full month names like "January".
d matches day numbers like "5" and "05".

option.p: Placeholders can be declared as optional by wrapping them in square brackets. This is useful if it is unclear whether the input contains a certain field or not. For example:

Optional placeholders can also be useful if different formats are to be expected. For example, [MMMM][MMM] dd, yyyy matches both "April 02, 2021" and "Apr 02, 2021". Note that this will also match when no month description is given whatsoever.
The full list of supported placeholders is given below. You can find a full, technical specification here.

ul.li: w: week of week based year

tab.option: A locale can be chosen, which determines the language and geographic region for terms such as months or weekdays.
Shows the content of the first non-missing cell of the first included column to simplify format selection.
If pressed the data type and the format are guessed based on the content of the first cell. If none of the formats in the list is suitable, type and format will not change.

tab.name: Abort Execution
tab.option: If checked, the node will abort the execution and fail on errors. If unchecked, missing values will be generated instead.

ports.outPort: Output table containing the parsed columns.
